title: Looking for some soft scripts, similar to the Cottonelle/Downy/Soft Scrub logos
content:
Can anybody identify these fonts?

The Cottonelle logo  
 [http://www.cottonelle.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.cottonelle.com/ "http://www.cottonelle.com/")

The Downy logo  
 [http://www.downy.com/en\_US/index.jsp](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.downy.com/en_US/index.jsp "http://www.downy.com/en\_US/index.jsp")

The Softscrub logo  
 [http://www.softscrub.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.softscrub.com/ "http://www.softscrub.com/")

Thank You so much  
Sruly
author: SrulyP

comments.content: I could be wrong, but I think all three of those brand marks are custom lettering.

OK people, let's play a game of lookalikes. Me first:

[FF Jambono](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11321.0.0)  
 [FF Tartine Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11326.0.0)

Both by [Xavier Dupre](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Xavier%20Dupr%C3%A9).

Who's next?

If you like that style:

[FF Tartine Script](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11326.0.0)  
 [Versa Bold Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=OU.118583.0.3)  
 [FF Strada Black Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.fontshop.com/showfont.cfm?fid=FF.11317.5.18)
No, I don't need logos, I just love these letterings, they're just so beautiful, come on ppl I'm sure you got something similar....

Oh I love inky scripts.

[Sign Painter](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=23) from House Industries.

Fink Brush, part of the [Rat Fink Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=20) set.

Fabulous, part of the [Las Vegas](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=27) set from House Industries.

Also from House: If you sign up for a free catalog you can download their free fonts, one of which is an all cap sign painter-esque font--HouseSlant. If you buy their book there is another great inky font on the CD--HouseMovements Sign.

[Bello](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.underware.nl/site2/index.php3?id1=bello&id2=overview), can't do a list like this without it.

The Cottonelle one reminds me of Forte MT, even though Forte is a good bit fatter. I agree about Spring; it's in the ballpark on copying that Downy logo.

Paul D. Hunt wrote:  
"if you need logos, try www.brandsoftheworld.com"

Many of the brand marks at that site are knock-offs. Some are better drawn than others. The site's not bad for just playing around with some logos whether they're authentic or not. Even still one can do better by grabbing logos from PDFs on a company's website (if the logos haven't been rasterized). Of course, for actual paid work, it's always best to obtain authentic artwork (and the useage guidelines) directly from the company.

When I see 'Script' in a thread title, I can't resist ;)

Styles like these would be mainly in Part 8 of the [Script Font ID Guide](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/bowfinprintworks.com/Script08Pg1.html) (Casual non-flowing scripts). Also might show up in Part 6, Sign Lettering, and even Part 5, Designed Scripts.

- Mike Yanega
[Art & Sign](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/artandsignstudio.com/fontmenu.html) has several very nice candidates as well.

Let me suggest  
 [Felipe](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts-felipe.htm)  
 [Sinfonieta](http://web.archive.org/web/20141023221251/http:/www.veer.com/products/typedetail.aspx?image=UMT0000211)

combining the alternates to give a less digital look :)

best,  
Ale
